title: LepEU: European Lepidopteran Population Genomics Consortium

markdown.markdown:
```{=html}
  1. Home
  2. Organisation
``` ::: {style="float: right; margin: 1px;"} ![](./images/hubtastic.png){.img} ::: LepEU is a network spanning 13 countries and 42 members. ## Co-organizers of LepEU - Patrícia Beldade, Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon, PT. - Mathieu Joron, Centre d'Ecologie Fonctionnelle et Evolutive (CEFE), FR. - Christopher Wheat, Stockholm University, SE. ## National collection coordinators ### North - **Estonia**: Tomas Tammaru, University of Tartu. - **Finland**: Marjo Saastamoinen, University of Helsinki. - **Sweden**: Niklas Wahlberg, Lund University. - **United Kingdom**: Joana Meier and Charlotte Wright, Wellcome Sanger Institute. ### Central - **Czech Republic**: Zdenek Fric, Entomologický ústav. - **France**: Mathieu Joron, Centre for Evolutionary and Functional Ecology (CEFE-CNRS). - **Germany**: Matthew Nielsen, University of Bremen. - **Poland**: Richard Bailey, University of Lodz. - **Switzerland**: Kay Lucek, University of Neuchâtel. ### East - **Romania**: Vlad Dinca, "Grigore Antipa" National Museum of Natural History. - **Turkey**: Başak Ulaşlı, Hatay Mustafa Kemal University, Plant Protection Department ### South - **Italy**: Emiliano Trucci, Marche Polytechnic University. - **Portugal**: Patrícia Beldade, Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon. - **Spain**: Constanti Stefanescu, Museum of Natural Sciences of Granollers. ## Web site and public outreach - **Web Administrator**: Saad Arif, Oxford Brookes, University, GB. ## Lep10K WG4 Members [10kLepGenomes COST Action](https://10klepgenomes.eu/ ) Working Group 4 (WG4) members are also associated with LepEU. The map below shows locations of the >100 members of WG4 based on their home institution.

```{=html}
  1. Home
  2. Organisation
``` ::: {style="float: right; margin: 1px;"} ![](./images/hubtastic.png){.img} ::: # The LepEU Network LepEU is a network spanning 13 countries and 42 members. ## Co-organizers of LepEU - Patrícia Beldade, Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon, PT. - Mathieu Joron, Centre d'Ecologie Fonctionnelle et Evolutive (CEFE), FR. - Christopher Wheat, Stockholm University, SE. ## National collection coordinators ### North - **Estonia**: Tomas Tammaru, University of Tartu. - **Finland**: Marjo Saastamoinen, University of Helsinki. - **Sweden**: Niklas Wahlberg, Lund University. - **United Kingdom**: Joana Meier and Charlotte Wright, Wellcome Sanger Institute. ### Central - **Czech Republic**: Zdenek Fric, Entomologický ústav. - **France**: Mathieu Joron, Centre for Evolutionary and Functional Ecology (CEFE-CNRS). - **Germany**: Matthew Nielsen, University of Bremen. - **Poland**: Richard Bailey, University of Lodz. - **Switzerland**: Kay Lucek, University of Neuchâtel. ### East - **Romania**: Vlad Dinca, "Grigore Antipa" National Museum of Natural History. - **Turkey**: Başak Ulaşlı, Hatay Mustafa Kemal University, Plant Protection Department ### South - **Italy**: Emiliano Trucci, Marche Polytechnic University. - **Portugal**: Patrícia Beldade, Faculty of Sciences of the University of Lisbon. - **Spain**: Constanti Stefanescu, Museum of Natural Sciences of Granollers. ## Web site and public outreach - **Web Administrator**: Saad Arif, Oxford Brookes, University, GB. ## Lep10K WG4 Members [10kLepGenomes COST Action](https://10klepgenomes.eu/ ) Working Group 4 (WG4) members are also associated with LepEU. The map below shows locations of the >100 members of WG4 based on their home institution.
